question01-formula.q: The clients are [segment] who want [goal] but cannot [action] because [one reason].
question01-formula.a: Private practice dentists who want to stay on trend but cannot regularly receive multi-vendor samples without attending trade shows, because suppliers focus only on their own products and ignore competitors.

question01.a: Private practice dentists in the USA with individual practices, holding licenses, actively seeking new products for patients.

question02.q: What do they want to accomplish?
question02.a: Stay current with market innovations to offer patients fresh solutions and remain competitive.

question03.a: Regularly receive diverse samples from different suppliers without significant effort at trade shows or personal negotiations.

question04.a: Suppliers aren't interested in multi-vendor distribution, and channels like trade shows are rare and inconvenient for busy professionals.

question01.a: Professional networks (ADA forums), social media (LinkedIn, dental groups), trade shows, online platforms for dentists.

question02.q: What are their pains and frustrations?
question02.a: Rare access to new samples, time wasted on trade shows, lack of overview of 'the full menu' from competitors.

question03.a: Regular packages with new products within a month of release, without effort to search.

question01.q: What is the minimum viable solution for this segment?
question01.a: Subscription for monthly packages with multi-vendor samples after license verification.

question02.q: What value metric matters most to them?
question02.a: Frequency and variety of samples, delivery time <1 month.

question03.q: What would make them choose this over alternatives?
question03.a: Convenience of regular delivery of 'the full menu' without travel, plus time savings.

question01.q: How can we test this hypothesis quickly?
question01.a: Survey 20-30 private practice dentists about willingness to pay for sample subscription.

question02.a: Confirmation: >50% willing to pay $20-50/month. Disproval: <20% interested.

question03.a: At least 60% positive responses in survey on interest in service.
